rComments: I generally like Kuttner, as he is good about answering questions and good at explaining concepts. He doesn't do example problems, though, and his math is hard to follow. Midterm and homework were tough but final was fair. Tough class but manageable if you keep up with the reading. I had him for Phys 8 too, and that was fun and easy.

awful prof.  very rude when anyone asks a question. only derives equations in class and refuses to do example problems. very messy tiny handwriting and hard to read. the curve is giant in the end, so don't worry too much.

His writing is very, very difficult to read because he writes small and extremely messy. A student in lecture asked if he could write bigger and he did for like 1 minute and then reverted back to his small, messy handwriting. The midterm is difficult and the final is worth half of your grade.  There are no discussion sections due to budget cuts.

Physics is a tough subject-read the text book, pay attention, go to class and do the homework. Fred is truly a great teacher; he can be condescending in class but he's trying to push you, so push back! I wouldn't miss a single lecture, they're all great and really helpful. Watch for algebra mistakes. The homework is ridiculous, do chapter problems!

His demonstrations do teach a thing or two, but his actual lectures don't.  The homework seemed impossible compared to the test, just look up the answers online (they're all there, especially if you subscribe to Cramster.)  Tests much easier than the HW, just to the practice tests.  The problems in the back of the book are good practice, but hard.
Horrible at explaining physics and didn't seem like he cared at all- said he had better things to do than hold office hours before the final. I was only able to do hw by looking up solutions online.

This guy doesn't teach/explain well at all. He rambles on about random physics that's hard to follow, plus he derives endlessly, which is hard to follow as well. Before the final, he went over the practice final and blatantly refused to answer/explain additional questions. His physical examples are the only interesting things he ever does in class.

Kuttner does a lot of derivations which is annoying because we're not a 5a. I don't think explaining derivations the entire class is helpful at all. His tiny small writing is frustrating. Very good person, just not on a student teacher level.

OMG! Lectures are IMPOSSIBLE to follow. Whenever someone had a question, he answers in an offensively way. He makes you feel dumb if you answer the questions wrong. He has high expectations and very unorganized class structure. Extremely stressful class :( TAs weren't extremely helpful because they didn't even know what was going on!!

I don't even see the point in coming to lecture. He just rambles on and on and half the time we don't know what he's talking about. Impossible to follow. Write messily/extremely tiny. Lectures one thing and tests on something else. He needs to DO PROBLEMS! Also I got a condescending vibe from him...

I was completely blown away during the final when his cell phone went off 7 times(on loud) and 2 of the times were when another student was in the middle of asking a question and he just answered his call and walked out of the room as if no one was there!

5%iclicker 20%homework 25%midterm 50%final. I got a 26% on my midterm and a 40% in my final and got a C in the class with A's in hw and clicker. He's not a very good lecturer if you like to learn from derivations. If you're struggling in this class, sections are useless as the TA's only take questions. Hard class to study by yourself.

Okay, I barely passed the class, it wasn't the guys fault. I'm just not good at this stuff, I'm a history major. The lectures were fascinating, the homework was HARD. If you're not getting it, do what I should have done but realized too late in the quarter: go to office hours! He is happy to help.

Never got the intimidating vibe others mentioned; maybe he teaches 6B differently. Very willing to take questions and answer them. Fun guy with great demos, but mostly focused on derivations and concepts rather than practice problems in lecture. Tests are straightforward, study and you should do fine. Class is curved. Book recommended.
Funny teacher that explains to you a world in which you cannot imagine. Homework is a little tricky so make sure you have a study buddy*.
Very likable teacher, but the homework can be a little confusing unless you use the textbooks/listen a lot during class.  Extremely interesting class however, would recommend it to anyone.

He's a nice guy. That said, in class he just derives things, and usually doesn't explain what variables are. I went to every lecture(-1), then I still had to read the book to do the homework. Pretty useless in lecture, and usually does not take kindly to being asked questions. I would avoid him.

A decent speaker, always kept me interested during lecture.  Gave a well organized and not overly complicated presentation of electromagnetism.  Tests probed basic understanding.  Lots of office hours and discussion made the class worthwhile.  I left more interested in this branch of physics than when I came in.

demos are AWESOME (esp for the 100kVolt). he's ok enough, lectures seems unnecessary for me, HW didnt really help for the tests, book use is minimal--overall i thought the test were fair and the final was EASY (for the final study all the past MD/prac MD/prac final). he's a moderate professor but im sure he'd be able to help anyone in need in OHs

Tough class for anyone to teach.  He doesnt do a particularly good job because he does do alot of deriving.  However conceptually if you listen very carefully, he does an ok job.  Don't ask questions during class... ask them during office hours.  He's much more impersonable during office hours.

He is definitely a nice person and has a good grasp of the conceptual part of physics, but he is not very good at explaining things. He lectures off power point slides which didn't help me learn physics, and it is very difficult to follow what he's saying. The exams are fairly straight forward and he does curve. Not very helpful during office hrs.

Really tough class and exams. His lectures pretty much consist of him doing derivatives. He is a nice guy though, but was very intimidating to talk to in class. He never did sample problems, but was willing to help with the homework during office hours. MSI saved me
Nicest guy you will ever meet. Great lecturer. Crystal clear. He even helped me  with physics over the phone once in a while. That said, I wish he would of done exam type questions in class.

I took Kuttner for E&M and he is a demanding teacher. If you speak up in class prepare to be challenged by him. He's very helpfull and is very welcoming at his office but he goes over problems really fast so you have to slow him down and go step by step if you want to get it.

He is a wonderful professor. No, he's not a jerk (for the person who said that). For his hw you just have to read the book a little and you'll have what you are looking for. Sure, his problems make you think, but if you can't handle that, drop out or something...

He's not that bad. A little dull, uses pretty much only powerpoint slides right from the book, teaches right out of the book. Just read the book and do the homework and you should pass. I got a B without really trying. The final was tricky but he must have curved. Tells funny stories and jokes occasionally, that was the best part of the class.

To those who are hating on Kutter, you all suck. You  just hate him cause u got lower than an A or got yelled at during exams. He's actually not so bad. Fred is really helpful and nice during office hours. Much better than Carter. And no, he didn't pay me to write this.

Kuttner's class is hard, but I think because he's gotten so much criticism he's mellowed out a lot. I got an A in the class with like a 50% on the final. Just read the text and do the homework, it's more than most people do so you will do well after the curve
When you take his class you will wonder why UCSC can't hire good professors.  He isn't fit to teach.  Best advice: Avoid this man, you have been warned!

Kuttner is aweful! His teaching style sucks, his lectures consist of derivations and the homework is rediculous! Kuttner is such a jerk! He crams everyone together like sardines for each exam while screaming at you! His final was impossible, and I studied my ass of and even took adderall! He made this class so much harder than it needs to be.
By far the worst teacher I have ever had.  He needs to forget about his research and focus on educating the future leaders of America!

Believe me, and it’s no exaggeration that he is THE WORST teacher I ever had in my entire life.  His final was harder than any test I have ever taken (that includes O Chem).  He absolutely has no regard for the learning process and makes tests so hard and impossible that no amount of studying will help.  Your best advice is to avoid taking him.

Easy to make angry.  He acts like a child during midterms, like the last comment said, so don't be easily bothered by rude remarks and bad behavior from a professor. His tests are hard, but the average scores are ok. If he doesn't get a handle on his temper, he may have a heart attack one day though.

He really needs to cut out the yelling and tantrums on exam mornings.  He talks to us like kindergartners, freaks out at you if your seat is broken, and sits you shoulder to shoulder on exams, all the while yelling and belittleing the entire class because on exam days HE IS STRESSED?  The most ill tempered teacher I have ever had! He's a total jerk

This was an awesome class. Really great material and a good presentation. He could be a little rough around the edges, but the lectures were generally really interesting. Not hard if you do all the homework...some stuff was unclear but probably cause  i don't do physics (i got an A nonetheless)

Great class - lectures really great in understanding super cool, exciting material, great experiments that really make this totally doable, even for non-science majors (like me). Stay up with the homework or tests will be hard. I thought I totally fouled up and the final and didn't do enough homework, but I still managed a B- for limited work.

15 hours a week on hw that has nothing to do with the test...painfull. studying like its your only class...extremely painfull. 9/30 class average on tests....sadisticaly painful. passing the class after living in the library, multiple tutors, gallons of red bull, and not seeing the sun....priceless. hardest class i have ever taken.

this class is impossible. the online hw is so time consuming. his tests are difficult and too long to be able to finish in time. i especially didn't think those voting remotes help at all. i've always hated physics ever since high school and in this class i think i hate it even more.

The class requires a lot of time, but it's certainly doable, and I'm not a physics major.  The online homework was actually very helpful, and I have to admit that the little remote required for lectures kept me on my toes.  He's a pretty good lecturer, more so when he's enthusiastic about a subject.

Worst class ever. The homework takes forever and it's hardly worth any points. He's intense when administering the midterms. We hardly get any time to complete the tests and when the time is up, he yells at people to drop their pencils. The midterms are so hard that even getting below 50% is considered in the B-range. Kuttner is way too intense.

While he knows his subject very well, and his letures are filled with interesting examples of current topic, he views his position as teacher as Stalin viewed Russia. He becomes very irratable during testing. His practice second mid term was not like the actual test, as in the actual test was mainly theory, not math calc's, which he did not go over

I studied for 6 hours a day for his class and 12 hours on weekends, spent money on tutors, went to every section and it still didn't work, and I'm an A student. Something is very wrong with that. If you care about your GPA, and are not a physics genius, do not take this class.

The online homework sucked, majorly. It took forever and was hardly worth any points (but worth enough that you had to do it). I slept through most of his lectures, though. Kinda boring sometimes. He just never gets that much into it, so I never got into it either. The days that he was excited I got excited too. :) Not an impossible class, anyway.

I don't understand the negativity people are giving. If you put at least 2 hours a day of your time reading and doing homework, you will do absolutely fine in his class. His lectures were interesting and informative. Study his notes and you'll be fine in h

At first, I felt dumb b/c I did not understand ANYTHING he was saying. Later on, he calmed down with his teaching and was a very nice teacher. His midterms were similar to the practice midterms and if you can find any past years sample midterms/midterms floating around, those are also very helpful to study off of. Overall, he made me like physics
Charasmatic and funny. his tests are predictable and if you study the HW problems you can't go wrong. Only bad thing are his RF transmitters.
No Comments

I don't know what the negative posts are all about, except that these people are bitter about NOT studying for Kuttner's exams and failing.  People, Kuttner isn't THE best physics teacher, but if you invest considerable time into his class, you'll find yourself liking physics.  Awesome teacher!
The online hw takes forever. His handwriting is horrible and lectures barely helped prepare me for the midterms and finals. HARD CLASS. I actually really liked physics in hs, but not anymore now.

I don't know where these positive ratings came from.  Kuttner is impossible unless you are a physics genius!  His tests are incredibly hard and the homework and class notes don't prepare you for the questions he asks on exams!  Totally unhelpful!  Don't take him!
I dont understand what any of you are talking about.  Prof. Kutter was absolutly aweful.  He made a hard subject impossible.  Not approachable. Dont take his classes!
very good teacher! U should take him. Test are not hard, just study. Go and talk to him.

I agree w the other positive posts; I accredit this class w beginning my ineffable love of physics (which I *never* thought would happen). Fred is entertaining and brings extra, fascinating history and stories into the lectures instead of just teaching by the book. Tests r not too bad- just study :)

his tests are no joke, if u want an A in this class, be prepared to forget about your old life and dedicate it to the Sci Li. Kuttner isnt so willing to answer questions and one on one help makes u feel like u're only 2' high compared to Kuttner's ego. Lectures need more practice problems & less cra
He makes the material fascinating and relates it to everyday occurences in the world around us.  The class definately requires effort, but he does at least make it interesting

fred's lectures were really interesting, the material at the end of the class on the quantum stuff was the good part, the classic physics for the first half was pretty boring. his quacky old TA was very brilliant but always told you how to live your life when you hadn't asked.

Professor Kuttner is one of the best professors I've ever had.  I never thought I would find Physics interesting until I had him.  He's passionate, motivated, and occasionally a funny guy.  Take a class with him; he'll change the way you think of Physics.

This guy is probably one of the best professors I've ever had; he's an amazing teacher, and makes physics so enjoyable; I'd totally reccommend the Quantum Enigma class he teaches; by far the best class I've taken here at Santa Cruz!
